bio:
Named Top 10 Travel Influencer by Forbes - 4X Winner Best Travel Blog-SATW NATJA
🌍105 countries/7 continents
🇨🇦Travel
🎦YouTube.com/theplanetd
🖨Blog⬇️

list.comment:
The stunning landscape of Cappadocia, Turkey.
---------
Cappadocia is known for its balloon rides and it is the landscape that makes it so special.
Never have I been in a ballon and seen a landscape that truly looks like you are on another planet.
If I were ever to take a trip to Mars this is what I imagine it would look like.
--------
#tkmoments #lovefromturkey #turkey

Next stop...Jasper, Alberta.
—-
The mountains are calling and so we must answer. Later this week we head off to Jasper, Alberta for the Dark Sky Festival.
It should be a great weekend.
—-
The Rockies are always top of our list for amazing landscapes and I think this trip won’t be any different. We have only visited Jasper once a long time ago so we are ready to get better acquainted.
—-
Also can’t wait to catch up with my good friend @photojbartlett and check his presentation!
—-
#travelalberta #explorecanada #jasper #myjasper

Arctic nights and Arctic Lights!
The Northern Lights dance across the sky on Hudson Bay in Manitoba, Canada
—-
We spent 4 nights up at Seal River Lodge in the shores of Hudson Bay with @churchillwildsafaris —-
We were lucky enough to see the Northern Lights twice while we were there. No matter how many times I see them I am always mesmerized by their beauty.
The way they dance and move it is like Mother Nature is putting on a show.
—-
It was -42 Celsius with the wind chill that night but it was worth it to endure the cold to witness this.
Canada’s North really offers some the most spectacular experiences in the world.
I can’t wait to explore more of this part of my country in 2019.
—-
Sony A7RIII
Rokinon 14mm 2.8
F/2.8
20 seconds
—-
#exploremb #explorecanada #churchillwildsafaris #manitoba

Fall arrives at The Great Wall of China
——
We spent the last 8 days around Beijing shooting a commercial for the tourism board and we got to go to the Badaling section of the Great Wall.
Here I was able to get my new Mavic Pro 2 in the air and test out the image quality.
Let me just say it is miles above that of the original. I will be using this guy a lot in the future!
—-
We have been to other sections of the wall and this was definitely the busiest. But it was really stunning to see it go on for miles!
—-
#visitbeijing #beijing #greatwallofchina #greatwall

The bridge to paradise at Pyramid Lake outside of Jasper, Alberta.
——
Sunrise is the time to photograph this spot. Not only do you have it all to yourself but the light is just spectacular.
I love the way the bridge leads the eye.
When you have the perfect conditions in Jasper it almost difficult to take a bad shot 😊.
——
Sony A7RII
16mm
F/11
25 seconds
10 stop ND
——
#myjasper #venturebeyond #explorecanada #travelalberta

A beautiful vista over Lake Chuzenji here in Nikko, Japan.
—-
The fall colours are out in full force here in Nikko. We took the cable car up to this lookout and man was it worth it.
It was like Mother Nature created the perfect scene.
The way the lake drains over the cliff side to form the Kegon Waterfall is picture perfect.
We have really loved this area of Japan and I hope you can see why.
If you want more info on this amazing area make sure to check out the link in our bio and @tobu_japan_trip ——
Sony A7RIII
Zeiss 24-70 f/4
F/11
10 seconds
——
#japan #nikko #nikkojapan #kegonfalls #lakechuzenji

Long shadows and a long road on the Icefields Parkway near Jasper, Alberta.
——
Out of all of the times we have visited Alberta we had never made it up to Jasper. We didn’t know what we were missing.
Driving down the parkway was such an incredible experience.
There was beauty at every turn.
—-
This was definitely one of my favourite ones. Located just outside the entrance road to Athabaska Falls this part of the park at is just beautiful.
Add the long shadows from the evening sun and you have a spectacular scene.
—-
Sony A7RII
Sony 70-200 f/4
F/11
1/160 sec.
——
#myjasper #venturebeyond #travelalberta #explorecanada

The mighty Kegon Falls in Nikko Japan.
——
I really wanted to see this waterfall in the fall. The colours just really popped.
It stands at almost 100m tall and flows out of Lake Chuzenji.
It is also ranked as one of Japan’s three most beautiful waterfalls!
—-
You can take an elevator down to 2 different viewing platforms which allows you to get the best views of this beautiful waterfall.
—-
This was one of the highlights of our trip to Nikko with @tobu_japan_trip.
You have to visit this once in your life!
—-
#japan #nikko #nikkojapan #kegonfalls #lakechuzenji #tobujapantrip

When the light is right at Pyramid Lake in Jasper, Alberta.
——
Our first morning in Jasper and it did not disappoint. We headed out to Pyramid Lake for sunrise and the water was like glass.
Combine that with the beautiful colours and you have the recipe for a great shot.
——
One of the hints. Have found here in Jasper is that you seem to have all of these beautiful spots to yourself.
Gotta love Alberta!
—-
#myjasper #travelalberta #explorecanada #canada

A Canadian scene unfolds in front of us just outside of Jasper, Alberta
——
As we were returning from our sunrise shoot at Pyramid Lake this scene caught my eye as we were driving past.
The lake was like glass and there was this lone canoe just off shore.
I remember turning to Deb and saying “Isn’t this just the perfect Canadian moment?”
——
That is the thing about driving around this area of Alberta. Beauty is around every corner.
——
Sony A7RII
Sony 24-70 f/4
F/11
1/100 sec
——
#myjasper #venturebeyond #travelalberta #explorecanada

The sun sets over the Tokyo Skytree in Japan.
——
This was my first time in Tokyo and man what a city. There is so many areas to visit and the Skytree is a must.
We travelled to Nikko with @tobu_japan_trip who has a railway that leaves from the SkyTree to Nikko. You can be in the countryside in 2 hours.
But for now we are enjoying the bright lights of Tokyo.
It offers incredible views over the city but it also makes for a great subject, especially when it is lit up, form many different spots around the city.
——
We got to explore many different areas of the city but we will be back as there is so much more that we want to do.
——
Sony A7RIII
Zeiss 16-35 f/4
F/11
30 seconds
——
#tobujapantrip #japan #tokyo #tokyoskytree #tokyoskyline
